sentences.en: a highly praised novel
sentences.cn: 受到高度赞扬的小说

sentences.en: Even his praise is double-edged.
sentences.cn: 即使他的赞扬都说得模棱两可。

sentences.en: Gregory was singled out (= he was chosen in particular ) for special praise .
sentences.cn: 格雷戈里被单独给予特别表扬。

sentences.en: He deserves the highest praise for his bravery.
sentences.cn: 他的英勇行为应该获得最高的赞誉。

sentences.en: He was effusive in his praise for the general.
sentences.cn: 他对那位将军极尽溢美之词。

sentences.en: He was effusive in his praise.
sentences.cn: 他极尽溢美之词。

sentences.en: He was fulsome in his praise of the Prime Minister.
sentences.cn: 他称赞首相时有溢美之词。

sentences.en: Her teacher was full of praise for her work.
sentences.cn: 老师对她的作业赞不绝口。

sentences.en: His first novel received high praise .
sentences.cn: 他的第一部小说受到了高度赞扬。

sentences.en: I have nothing but praise for the police.
sentences.cn: 我对警方唯有称赞。

sentences.en: It is difficult to praise this immaculately researched work too highly.
sentences.cn: 这项研究工作毫无瑕疵，怎样称赞都不过分。

sentences.en: It’s important to give children plenty of praise and encouragement.
sentences.cn: 对小孩子多加表扬和鼓励是很重要的。

sentences.en: Jane was praised by her teacher.
sentences.cn: 简受到了老师的表扬。

sentences.en: Praise is a great confidence booster.
sentences.cn: 赞扬是一种很好的信心增强剂。

sentences.en: Prince Sadruddin lavished praise on Britain's contributions to world diplomacy.
sentences.cn: 萨德鲁丁王子大力赞扬英国对世界外交作出的贡献。

sentences.en: She asked the church to praise God.
sentences.cn: 她请求教会赞美上帝。

sentences.en: spontaneous outpourings of praise
sentences.cn: 一片自然迸发的赞美声

sentences.en: That is high praise indeed.
sentences.cn: 那真是高度的赞美。

sentences.en: The book drew lavish praise from literary critics.
sentences.cn: 文学评论家们对此书好评如潮。

sentences.en: The film has won praise from audiences and critics alike.
sentences.cn: 那部电影赢得了观众和评论家的一致赞誉。

sentences.en: The team also won praise for sportsmanship and fair play.
sentences.cn: 该队还因其良好的体育精神及公平竞争精神而受到了表扬。

sentences.en: They have been listening to people's gripes, moans and praise.
sentences.cn: 他们一直在倾听人们的牢骚、抱怨和表扬。

sentences.en: Uncle Felix never stopped singing her praises.
sentences.cn: 费利克斯叔叔没完没了地赞扬她。

words.tran_cn: 值得赞扬的；赞不绝口的

trans.tran_en: words that you say or write in order to praise someone or something
to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly
to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly
to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly
